title: Volunteers needed for research studies (phone calling or home visits)

organizer.name: Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities
organizer.description:
ABOUT THK

Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) is the charity arm of Thye Hua Kwan Moral Society (THKMS) and was incorporated in October 2011 as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large. THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 70 programmes, services, welfare homes and centres. These services are catered to namely the Elderly, Families, Children & Youths and Persons with Disabilities.


WHY VOLUNTEER WITH THK?

Always visiting the same old places, or doing the same things during your free time? Not sure how you can better invest your time while making a difference. 

We are here to change your perspective as there are always a fresh way of looking at something. Sometimes a break from your routine is the very thing you need! 
Be a THK Aviator and allocate your time to worthy causes. From caring for youths at risk and the elderly to lending a hand at outreach activities and events, we have endless volunteering opportunities where you will feel good by doing good. 

1.	Discover yourself and you will be happier and healthier
Life can be full of challenges but with every new volunteering opportunity, it gives you a new perspective. Donating time to others is good for your mind and body as you get to interact with people and be their voice. The more you volunteer, the more experiences you gain, thus having a special sense of belonging and achievement. 

2.	You have time for more
When you give your time to others, in turn you will have more time on hand. You connect with others, and when focusing on other people, it makes you feel less time constrained.
 
3.	Learn and gain new skills 
Volunteering is like an adventure, oftentimes you might find yourself in for a fun surprise. Giving your time opens opportunities for you to develop and practise new skills such as communication, social and leadership skills. Inspire others to give back and journey as one to help transform lives.
organizer.address: 1 North Bridge Road #03-33 High Street Centre Singapore 179094

title: Help our hawkers go digital
description:
Ground-Up Project
•	The SG Together Alliance for Action (AfA): Online Ordering for Hawkers was formed on 17 June 2021 to:
•	Ensure hawkers have a place, amidst evolving dining habits driven by technological change and Covid-19 pandemic; and 
•	Help hawkers understand the benefits of going digital

•	We are looking for volunteers to support Geylang East Market & Food Centre in addressing the digital literacy gap among hawkers. 
About Geylang East Market & Food Centre
•	Big food centre that sells a variety of cooked food at an affordable price 
•	Located in 117 Aljunied Avenue 2
•	79 cooked food stalls out of about 160 stalls in total
•	70% of stallholders are above 50 years old
•	Some famous or popular stalls include Xiang Gang Xin Kou Wei (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jyA0mv_mTTY), recommendations from Makansutra https://makansutra.com/fave-5-aljunied-food-centre

The Mission
•	Rally Thye Hua Kwan volunteer network to work with a Digital Hawker Champion to help the less tech savvy, elderly hawkers in two areas:
1.	Build digital presence via Facebook platform, social media etc.
2.	Raise consumer demand through group buys and bulk purchases from nearby corporate offices etc.
one_line_description: Empower our hawkers to go digital

title: Food packers needed for our Kitchen
description:
We need volunteers to continue our services to the community. To ensure that we continue our operations of sending out warm and cooked meals to our seniors, your help is required in our battle against this pandemic.

During packing, all participants must wear disposable hat liners, gloves and a plastic apron.  Volunteers will only be handling cooked food items for packing.
They are advised to attend a food hygiene course.   

ART test is to be done before entering the premises.

There will be 2 shifts for volunteers to sign up.

(7.30 a.m. - 11.00 a.m. and 12.00 noon - 3.00 p.m.)

Commitment is 3 months duration.
one_line_description: Food packing

title: Kasih Sayang
description:
Kasih Sayang is a Community Fridge that caters fresh food for the community. Distribution is done once a week, and is open to the community. The fridge will be stocked in the morning before the distribution, and cleaned at the end of the week.
The produce includes fresh fruit, vegetables, and seafood, meant to provide the community with access to healthy and nutritious food to supplement their diet.

Group volunteers are also welcome to register - please ask your representative to contact us at the listed email.

Please not that signing up here indicates your interest for this specific project. If you have yet to register with the SG Cares Volunteer Centre @ Jalan Besar, please do so as well at this link: https://bantu.life/event/2227.
one_line_description: Help to maintain the hygiene and cleanliness of a community fridge!

title: Decluttering for the Needy
description:
This project may include de-cluttering, painting, moving of furniture, and simple repairs around the house. Please feel free to register your interest, and we will match you with a potential partner in need within the town of Jalan Besar. 

Group volunteers are also welcome to register - please ask your representative to contact us at the listed email. 

Signing up here indicates your interest for this specific project. If you have yet to register with the SG Cares Volunteer Centre @ Jalan Besar, please do so as well at this link: https://bantu.life/event/2227.
one_line_description: Volunteers will be involved in de-cluttering and reorganising a home to create a safe space for the residents to live in.

organizer.name: Kampong Kapor Community Services
organizer.address: https://www.kkcs.org.sg/

title: Volunteers Wanted! Training the Urban Farmer Trainers Part 2
description:
Do you enjoy the world of plants? This Urban Farmer training session is perfect for you! Volunteers with a keen interest in greens can join us on a journey to Citiponics, where urban farmers will show you their farming equipment and share knowledge on harvesting techniques. Learning these skills will allow you to better guide elderly beneficiaries during our Urban Farming sessions held at our Seniors Activity Centres. Come along and grow your green thumbs!

Volunteer Responsibilities:

- Open to all
- Volunteers with interest in gardening/farming are encouraged to sign up!
- Commitment minimum of 3 months 

In this Train-the-Urban farm trainers programme. 

Volunteers will need to commit to at least to either 2 weekdays (Thursday evening)  or 2 weekend sessions (Saturday morning) at the rooftop farm.
Each session will take about 2hrs.

Volunteers will go through a thorough training programme conducted at the farm. You will learn basic understandings of plant life cycle, to hands on planting activity throughout the premises of the farm. The interest group will later be tasked to transferring the produce & knowledge to our 17 Seniors Activity Centre.

You will also be required to attend a compulsory online orientation:
Next orientation will be on 25th Sept 930am.
one_line_description: Learn more techniques about urban farming with Citiponics!

title: Operations Assistant (Senior Activity Centre)
description:
Join the group of dedicated volunteers at the Senior Activity Centers (SACs).  Whether you volunteer on a regular basis or only for special occasions, the Center needs you to help keep the Center's programs successful and running smoothly. 

Responsibilities:
â€¢	Perform basic housekeeping of the Centre.
â€¢	Support the Centre Staff in the smooth running of the center. during lunchtime or when staff is out for assignments.
â€¢	Provide simple admin support. 
â€¢	Render assistance to seniors

Requirements:
â€¢     Able to converse in Malay, Tamil, Mandarin, or any dialect.
â€¢	Possess passion and empathy in helping the elderly.
â€¢	Has patience in connecting with others and form positive. relationships.

Time Commitment:
â€¢	Selection of day and time as per volunteerâ€™s availability
â€¢     Up to 4 hours per session

Location:
We would match you to the nearest THK Active Ageing Centre:
â€¢	Bedok South / Central 
â€¢	Toa Payoh Lor 6, 7, 8 / Central 
â€¢	Ang Mo Kio Ave 5, 6, 8 ,9 / Central 
â€¢	Beo Crescent 
â€¢	Boon Lay Place/Boon Lay Drive 
â€¢	Taman Jurong/ Tah Ching Rd/ Yuan Ching Rd/ Kang Ching Rd
one_line_description: Join us and make a difference in a seniorâ€™s life!

title: Medical Escorts (Home for Disabled)
description:
Responsibilities:
â€¢	Accompany and provide support to the residents before/ during/ between transportation.
â€¢	Attend to residentâ€™s needs and provide physical assistance, if needed
â€¢	Settling of payment (if required), scheduling of future appointments, and collecting of medicine at the pharmacy
â€¢	Provide accurate and timely updates to the Nursing team

Requirements:
â€¢	Ability to speak in Mother Tongue and/or one dialect.
â€¢	Ability to read and speak in English is preferred.
â€¢	No major health problems
â€¢	Passion for working with people with special needs

Time Commitment:
â€¢	No minimum hours required (a typical trip takes up to 2-4 hours) 
â€¢	Actual assignments depend on the number of medical appointments

Location:
We would match you to the nearest centre;
1.	THK Home for Disabled @ Sembawang
        7 Sembawang Walk, Singapore 756977
2.	THK Home for Disabled @ Eunos
        20 Jalan Eunos, Singapore 419494
3.	THK Home for Disabled Adults @ Chai Chee
        2 Chai Chee Lane, Singapore 469030
one_line_description: Be part of team to keep our residents healthy!

one_line_description: Join us as a Volunteer Activity Coordinator for residents in the disability programme

organizer.name: Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities
organizer.description:
ABOUT THK

Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) is the charity arm of Thye Hua Kwan Moral Society (THKMS) and was incorporated in October 2011 as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large. THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 70 programmes, services, welfare homes and centres. These services are catered to namely the Elderly, Families, Children & Youths and Persons with Disabilities.


WHY VOLUNTEER WITH THK?

Always visiting the same old places, or doing the same things during your free time? Not sure how you can better invest your time while making a difference. 

We are here to change your perspective as there are always a fresh way of looking at something. Sometimes a break from your routine is the very thing you need! 
Be a THK Aviator and allocate your time to worthy causes. From caring for youths at risk and the elderly to lending a hand at outreach activities and events, we have endless volunteering opportunities where you will feel good by doing good. 

1.	Discover yourself and you will be happier and healthier
Life can be full of challenges but with every new volunteering opportunity, it gives you a new perspective. Donating time to others is good for your mind and body as you get to interact with people and be their voice. The more you volunteer, the more experiences you gain, thus having a special sense of belonging and achievement. 

2.	You have time for more
When you give your time to others, in turn you will have more time on hand. You connect with others, and when focusing on other people, it makes you feel less time constrained.
 
3.	Learn and gain new skills 
Volunteering is like an adventure, oftentimes you might find yourself in for a fun surprise. Giving your time opens opportunities for you to develop and practise new skills such as communication, social and leadership skills. Inspire others to give back and journey as one to help transform lives.
organizer.address: 1 North Bridge Road #03-33 High Street Centre Singapore 179094

title: Befrienders for Active Ageing Centres ( 6 Island-wide locations)
description:
In this programme, we look for like-minded individuals who want to empower and enrich the seniors in the neighbourhoods of:
1) Bedok South / Central
2) Toa Payoh Lor 6, 7, 8 / Central
3) Ang Mo Kio Ave 5, 6, 8 ,9 / Central
4) Beo Crescent
5) Boon Lay Place/Boon Lay Drive
6) Taman Jurong/ Tah Ching Rd/ Yuan Ching Rd/ Kang Ching Rd

Requirements
- You must commit a minimum 2 hours of visiting per week during working hours 9am-5pm.
- You possess the following skills:

* Good Listener 
* Ability to interact with a seniors/ Basic communication skills through one of the following: Mandarin, Malay, Hindi, Tamil and other dialects
* Caring and empathetic
* Non-judgmental
* Able to write simple reporting in English
* Simple observational skills

You can look forward to:
- Training on engaging seniors, identifying depression and other useful skills for working with our silver citizens
- Attractive benefits

We would like to welcome you to join our family and network  of THK Befrienders.

**All suitable candidates will  go through a simple interview and a volunteer's induction programme.
**Your schedule will be discussed after signup.
one_line_description: Join us in the fight against LONELINESS AND DEPRESSION.

title: Medical Escort needed (Weekdays)
description: We are looking for a volunteer to help to bring one of our elderly clients to the hospital for medical appointment. Client may be on wheelchair bound as well hence, we will be providing training for the interested volunteers.

title: Escorts for Seniors @ AMK
description:
Enjoy spending time with the elderly? Talk up a storm and get to know our senior clients! We need your assistance to escort them for their weekly activities:
- Banking
- Taking a walk
- Grocery shopping
- Getting a drink at nearby coffeeshop

Requirements:
- Volunteers may carry out duties weekly or every alternate week
- Tentative day and time: Thursdays, 10.30am; Volunteers may discuss timings after signing up
one_line_description: Befriend and help escort the elderly for their weekly activity!

title: Caring Assistance from Neighbours (CAN) Carers @ Ang Mo Kio
description:
Volunteers will assist in the following:
- Conduct regular home visits to monitor vulnerable seniors
- Feedback on any changes regarding the seniors
- Establish and maintain relationships
- Provide emotional and social support

Volunteer Requirements:
- Open to all
- Able to commit 4 times a month, fortnightly on weekday or weekend (your timeslots will be confirmed after sign-up)
- Minimum Age: 21
one_line_description: CAN Carers provide social support through monitoring vulnerable elderly with complex needs to enable them to age in place within the community for as long as possible.

title: Volunteers Wanted! Assist in Pre-Vocational Classes @ Eunos
description:
Our Pan-Disability Centre requires YOUR help! Join us and assist in facilitating and delivering pre-vocational lessons to our clients.

Details:
- Mondays to Fridays
- Lesson timeslots: 1pm-2pm, 2pm-3pm
- Lessons are conducted using CANVAS LMS & Nearpod, training will be provided
- iPads are used for the lessons, other learning activities may be included

Volunteer Requirements:
- Able to commit for at least 3 months
- Able to commit daily
- Please note that once confirmed for this activity, you cannot volunteer at other centres due to safety measures and precautions

**You will be informed if any details such as location or timing of activity are subjected to change.

Got questions? WhatsApp or call us @ 8721 8599
one_line_description: Help our clients with their pre-vocational classes!

title: CAN Carers wanted! (Bedok)
description:
Caring Assistance From Neighbours provides social and healthcare support to the elderly, which empowers neighbours within a community to be given the role of a carer.

Responsibilities of a CAN Carer:
* Conduct regular home visits to monitor vulnerable seniors
* Feedback on any changes regarding the seniors
* Establish and maintain relationships
* Provide emotional and social support

Volunteer Requirements:
*Minimum age of 21
*Able to commit 4 times a month, weekday or weekend (your timeslots will be confirmed after sign-up)
*Ability to communicate in Mother Tongue and/or Mandarin dialect is preferred
*Training on managing the elderly will be provided
one_line_description: Caring Assistance From Neighbours (CAN) Service @ Bedok

title: Volunteering at the Parada School in Uttaradit/Thailand
description: Teaching basic spoken English or Chinese to our kindergarten kids. You would only teach in the morning and in the afternoon you are able to explore the beauty of Uttaradit City.

organizer.name: Paradanusorn School Uttaradit/Thailand
organizer.description: We are a general education school in Uttaradit/Thailand and have approx. 500 pupils. The kids are between 3 and 15 years old. We teach mainly kids from low or poor income families and therefore need your help, in volunteering at our school.

title: AMKFSC Volunteers
description:
Founded in 1978, AMKFSC Community Services Ltd. ("AMKFSC") is a community-based social service agency, which provides a holistic range of services to support children, youths, families and seniors at multiple touchpoints across Singapore.

AMKFSC operates four family service centres across Ang Mo Kio, Sengkang and Punggol. We also provide other support services such as student care, senior services, a youth centre, mental health support programmes and a transitional shelter.

*As the volunteer role is generic, we will reach out to you on the available roles. If you did not receive any email of confirmation, kindly email or call us!
one_line_description: General volunteering supporting all functions of a charity to better the services for the beneficiaries

organizer.name: AMKFSC Community Services
organizer.description:
Founded in 1978, AMKFSC Community Services Ltd. ("AMKFSC") is a leading community-based social service agency, which provides a holistic range of services to support children, youths, families and seniors at multiple touchpoints across Singapore.

AMKFSC operates four family service centres across Ang Mo Kio, Sengkang and Punggol. We also provide other support services such as student care, senior services, a youth centre, a transitional shelter and mental health support programmes.
organizer.address: 133 New Bridge Road, Chinatown Point #04-09 Singapore 059413
